page.title: 14CONSERVATION AROUND BURWELL.
page.content: The{Cambridge Conservation Corps}are clearing{The Devil's Ditch}of privet,hawthorn and brambles.It is a {historic monument}on chalkland some 7 miles long and 12-18 feet high. Starting at Reach,it finishes near Wood Ditton.Its history is less sure.It could be{Roman or Saxon.}It is being cleared so the chalkland stays open for special flora such as the {Pasque Flower}orchid that grows on it.A group member said,"You may have to conserve somethings at the expense of others." The cost is 95p for every person helping.This goes towards mending tools and making sure they work.They also charge 30p for each mile their van,{'The Ambulance',}travels.All this money is paid by{CAMBIENT (Cambridge {and Isle of Ely Naturalists Trust)}who asked them to do it.
